New Records: Carlos Correa extended his hitting streak to 16 games, matching a career-high and the longest by a Twin this season.
Key Match Events: Carlos Correa drove in all four Minnesota runs, including a clutch, go-ahead, two-run single in the 10th inning.
Bailey Ober struck out a career-high 12 batters in seven innings.
Ronny Henriquez and Michael Tonkin allowed three runs in a 5-4, walk-off loss to the Guardians.
Kyle Manzardo hit an RBI single, Andrés Giménez walked, and Will Brennan hit the game-tying knock in the 10th inning.
Brayan Rocchio hit a grounder over the head of first baseman Carlos Santana to walk off for the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Bailey Ober emphasized the need to move on and get ready for the next game.
Carlos Correa highlighted the importance of forgetting about the loss and focusing on winning the next game.
Manager Rocco Baldelli commented on the bullpen's inability to hold the lead due to player unavailability.
